document.docAuthor: Mu, Yannan, Jin, Chi & Zhang, Feng
document.docTitle: Otacilia guoi Mu & Jin & Zhang 2022, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Description of eight new species of Otacilia Thorell, 1897 from southern China (Araneae: Phrurolithidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Description of eight new species of Otacilia Thorell, 1897 from southern China (Araneae: Phrurolithidae)

materialsCitation.location: Liziping National Natural Reserve Gongyihai Station

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Holotype ♂ : CHINA :
Sichuan Province
: Ya’an City , Shimian County , Liziping National Natural Reserve Gongyihai Station , Mamadi ( 28°59.65′N , 102°24.53′E ,
2516 m
elev.),
24 Jul. 2016
, leg. Xiangbo Guo.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Paratypes :
2♂ 3♀ , with same data as holotype
;
5♂ 2♀ , same station as holotype , Hot spring ( 29°01.50′N , 102°23.07′E ,
2032 m
elev.),
25 Jul. 2016
, leg. Xiangbo Guo
;
2♂ , Liziping National Natural Reserve Zima Station ( 28°58.67′N , 102°16.50′E ,
1926 m
elev.),
28 Jul. 2016
, leg. Xiangbo Guo.
Etymology. The specific name is taken from the family name of Xiangbo Guo, the collector of this new species; noun in genitive case.

Diagnosis. This new species resembles
O. simianshan Zhou, Wang & Zhang, 2013
in having a similarly shaped RTA, FA, and bursa (see Fig. 5B–C and fig. 2B–C in Zhou et al. 2013), but males can be distinguished by the narrow RTA ( vs broad, compare Fig. 5B with fig. 2C in Zhou et al. 2013) and the round TA ( vs triangular, compare Figs 4C , 5C with figs 2B, 3F in Zhou et al. 2013). Females can be distinguished by the large spermathecae ( vs small, compare Figs 4F , 5F with figs 2E, 3I in Zhou et al. 2013) and the long and closely situated connecting tube ( vs short and separated, compare Figs 4E , 5E with figs 2D, 3H in Zhou et al. 2013).

Description. Male: total length 3.39–3.65 (n=10). Holotype ( Fig. 1C ): total length 3.53, carapace 1.68 long, 1.46 wide (CW); abdomen 1.85 long, 1.27 wide. Eye sizes and interdistances: AME 0.10, ALE 0.09, PME 0.08, PLE 0.10; AME–AME 0.06, AME–ALE 0.02, ALE–ALE 0.25, PME–PME 0.13, PME–PLE 0.09, PLE–PLE 0.46, ALE–PLE 0.13. Eye area 0.58 wide (EAW), cephalic region 0.82 wide (CRW), EAW/CRW 0.71. CRW/CW 0.56. MOA 0.27 long, anterior width 0.23, posterior width 0.31. Clypeal height 0.14 ( CH ), CH /AME 1.40. Chelicerae with three promarginal and eight retromarginal teeth. Carapace brown, with light ring around margin of carapace. Abdomen oval, gray, with small and diamond-shaped dorsal scutum anteriorly, two arrow-like black spots beside scutum, and three black chevron stripes posteriorly ( Fig. 1C ).

Palp as in Figs 4A–D , 5A–D . FA strong raised, located at middle part, with short longitudinal depression on posterior side ( Fig. 4B ). Tibia with sclerotized rounded prolateral apophysis. RTA longer than tibia, nearly half length of cymbium, broad, slightly curved, tapering abruptly to thin tip. Middle part of distal tegulum with weakly sclerotized, subtriangular, protruding excrescence. Sperm duct distinct, surrounding membranous excrescence. Embolus thin, originating at ten o’clock of tegulum. Conductor absent, TA round.

Female: total length 3.52–3.81 (n=5). One paratype ( Fig. 1D ): total length 3.81, carapace 1.73 long, 1.51 wide (CW); abdomen 2.04 long, 1.36 wide. Eye sizes and interdistances: AME 0.09, ALE 0.10, PME 0.09, PLE 0.11; AME – AME 0.05, AME – ALE 0.13, ALE – ALE 0.24, PME – PME 0.09, PME – PLE 0.07, PLE – PLE 0.43, ALE – PLE 0.12. Eye area 0.57 wide (EAW), cephalic region 0.79 wide (CRW), EAW/CRW 0.72. CRW/CW 0.52. MOA 0.25 long, anterior width 0.22, posterior width 0.30. Clypeal height 0.13 ( CH ), CH / AME 1.44 . Other characters as for male, except four black chevron stripes posteriorly on abdomen, lack of DS, heavier color and slightly larger body size ( Fig. 1D )
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 4.
Otacilia guoi
sp. nov.
: A. Male left palp, prolateral view; B. same, retrolateral view; C. Same, ventral view; D. same, dorsal view; E. epigyne, ventral view; F. Same, dorsal view.

FIGURE 5.
Otacilia guoi
sp. nov.
: A. Male left palp, prolateral view; B. same, retrolateral view; C. Same, ventral view; D. same, dorsal view; E. epigyne, ventral view; F. Same, dorsal view. Abbreviations: A—atrium; B—bursa; CD—copulatory duct; CO—copulatory opening; CT—connecting tube; E—embolus; FA—femoral apophysis; FD—fertilization duct; GA—glandular appendage; PTA—prolateral tibial apophysis; RTA—retrolateral tibial apophysis; S—spermatheca; SD—sperm duct; TA— tegular apophysis. Scale bars: 0.5 mm (A, B, D), 0.2 mm (C, E, F).
